description: Represent the ring R = {x+y*sqrt(-2): x, y rational integers} by the cells centered at the points (x,y) of a square grid, as in A345437; number the cells of the grid along a counterclockwise square spiral, with the cells at (0,0) and (1,0) numbered 0, 1; then a(n) is the norm x^2+2*y^2 of the element of R occupying the n-th cell.
